intro: Pouteria unmackiana, commonly known as the pink mombin, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The fruit is a fleshy, orange berry that contains a single large seed, making it distinctive from other members of the genus. The plant thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
